spec.name: The Clock Tower
spec.description: The Clock Tower (Tour de l'Horloge) is a prominent landmark located at the entrance to the Old Medina. The original tower, built in **1909** by **GÃ©nie Bouillot**, was one of the first major public structures erected by the French Administration, symbolizing the beginning of the modern city's expansion. The original tower was **demolished in 1948** and the current replica was **rebuilt in 1993**. It serves as a historical and symbolic gate between the Old Medina and the new city.
